summary: An internal FBI email from August 6, 2019, discussing plans for drafting and executing a search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email coordinates logistics for FBI personnel to travel and conduct a search expected to last 1-3 days.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Author of the initial email planning the search warrant execution for Epstein's island, leading Squad C-20 which investigates crimes against children and human trafficking.

events.title: Search warrant affidavit drafting for Epstein's island
events.description: SDNY is in the process of drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to St. Thomas
events.description: FBI personnel plan to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant on Epstein's island.

events.title: Planned search of Epstein's island
events.description: The search of Epstein's island is expected to take 1-3 days, managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).

events.title: Planned FBI travel home
events.description: Thursday is planned as the travel day home for FBI personnel after completing the search.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas in August 2019.
The search warrant affidavit was being drafted by SDNY, with plans to swear it out on Friday in St. Thomas.
FBI personnel planned to travel on Sunday, August 11, 2019, using an FBI Q400 aircraft.
The search was expected to last 1-3 days and be managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).
The email demonstrates coordinated law enforcement action targeting Epstein's properties shortly before his death in August 2019.
